reviews.text: We took a guided tour with Alex! He was very knowledgeable. We asked lots of obscure questions and he had all the answers! The tour takes you back in time and felt magical! We were even served authentic from the time shortbread by the lovely cook in costume. I learned so much and I will definitely come back in the summer to explore the grounds! My parents have travelled all over the world and said it was their favourite guides tour ever! Wow!!! Great job! Great place!!

A lovely guided tour. Highly recommend it for any lover of history and historic mansions. Our guide, Phillip was wonderful,  very knowledgeable, full of historic facts, and very witty. I encourage young and old to visit Dundurn castle.  We love visiting it. Thank you

Very cool. Came here on family day, so it was a little busy and we had a wait of an hr or so for our tour but we spent the extra time viewing the museums. The gift shop here has some unique items that you wouldn't find at most Canadian gift shops. The tour guide was friendly, and knowledgeable.

An interesting old mansion to tour, it's a castle in name only.  There's a lot of neat history here, and the tour guides seem quite knowledgeable.  I'm not sure why it's in Tripadvisor's top 10 places to visit in Ontario, it's a good visit, but surely not top 10 among everything.  It's quite beautiful inside and a nice treat to see how people (well the rich) lived back then.  Worth a visit if you're in the area.

Lovely historic museum.
Excellent guided tour! Beautifully decorated interior. Very enjoyable and informative! Highly recommend for an afternoon outing!

Enjoyed my recent visit to the art gallery of Hamilton. Lots of parking near by. Gallery was very clean and calm. During my visit there was an illuminating exhibition on origami including many interactive opportunities. Will be coming back in the future. Great location and very accessible. Many places to visit near by as well.  I enjoyed the sculpture garden outdoors too.

This is a small but wonderful museum packed with interesting, beautiful, and inspiring works of art. I come here for inspiration and also to just appreciate the local & international art pieces. It's a bright modern building with multiple floors and there is a section that if you have kids  they would enjoy and appreciate it.

My brother-in-law and sister-in-law had their engagement party here. It was quite lovely and we have really good service. The staff was wonderful, and the space is excellent for someone who is creative. My sister-in-law definitely is and used it quite well, making it look very elegant and beautiful!
The art there was nice to look at. Strong security systems. Students in some schools are with free admission. Check their official site for details
Nice place for some enjoyment.such as paper arts,life performance.And you can buy drinks and snack here.

The Canadian Football Hall of Fame is closed. The inductee busts have been moved to the Civic Football Stadium, along with the statue Touchdown.
CityLab is an administrative division of the City of Hamilton and is now housed on the upper levels.
Building looked nice.    Was working outside of it.   Lots of pay  parking.

As the standing is for the time being, a plan has been created to repurpose the building. It will no longer be the "Canadian football hall of fame" but will be workshop for students from Mohawk college and McMaster university and members of community to work on problems with in the City of Hamilton in terms of infrastructure, modes of transportation, and other ideas and how to solve them with modern technology. 
This building will be renamed as "CityLabs"

really worn down and not kept up. to hold the history of the CFL and Canadian football in such a shabby out of the way place is sad. I'd recommend checking it out and supporting it so it hopefully gets better.

I am a diehard cfl fan that grew up in Milton  Ontario  moved to Edmonton  alberta  when I  was 18 .I became a  Edmonton  Eskimo  season  ticket holder  in 1981 and have been since.I finally went back to Ontario  for a holiday  in June of this year  I decided to go to the cfl hall of fame in Hamilton  .After paying for a parking spot  we walked up to the building we found out it was closed indefinitely It was a very sad day for me to find it was closed as I have tried to support the cfl for many years . It just shows me how much the East supports this Canadian  game of ours.yours truly,  deeply disappointed  football  fan from the west.
Great spot for a walk, to watch birds, and enjoy nature. It is fun to walk out on the ice in the winter and follow animal tracks.
Took the dog for a walk through the trails in the snow. Beautiful even in the winter. Appreciate the new signage with information and history of the point.
Great park for a walk on a sunny day or even a cloudy day, regardless go for a walk instead of sitting inside all day.............................. am I right?

Did you know that Princess Point is a tall grass prairie? Check it out! It's a great spot to take your kids and go for a little stroll. Or sit in the big red chairs and enjoy the view. Or launch your canoe here. Or paddle your kayak. Or watch the terns that migrate through in the fall. Or have a picnic.
So good... my kid’s love bird watching and following animal tracks in the snow.

It has grown so much since I was young..still beautiful. Lake Champlain . The only reason it was never listed as a great lake is because u can see the other side. But,it was big enough. I was born in VT. & spent many years on & off there. Lake Champlain is a place for BBQ'S, swimming & just  escaping. Having family & or friends fun.
We always love coming down here for a walk or just to play in the field with the kids. All year they have fun stuff going on usually, kids day, fourth of July with fireworks, tons of events.
The sun is shining, a breeze is blowing, and the lake is frozen over from shore to shore. It's an amazing day on the waterfront in Burlington!

This is a great place to watch the sunset. There are lots of show's during the summer,wide variety of shops, dispensary, ferry, awesome bike path, short ride to North Beach. There is a dog park, skatepark, lots of places to sit, wheelchair accessible and lots of grass to walk on, parking,boat ramps docks, playground.

Great spot on the Lake in downtown Burlington.  Convenient to parking, docks, a waterfront walking trail, Skinny Pancake crepe shop and the Leahy museum.  More than a bit cold in the winter but usually delightful in the summer and fall.  Short walk uphill to everything in downtown Burlington, a great spot to visit.
Great little shop in town

We had three windows and two doors installed. The job was done in a timely manner with little disruption to our household. All the old windows & doors were taken away.There was no mess what so ever left. We are very happy with our new windows and Doors. I would definitely recommend Morley Windows & Doors
Had our windows done six years ago, along with some outside work. Very happy with the product, price and professionalism of the team.

Really groovy Mediterranean shawarma place with a great selection, cool atmosphere and the food quality is fantastic as well. A great deal of menu options are available and the place has some hip Arabic tunes going on. The decor is appealing and the overall feel is pleasant. Would definitely visit again!
This place is not as good as it use to be. Three years ago it was great. The food is still excellent, but now they charge you more and give you smaller portions.

Always friendly and helpful staff. Ingredients are consistently fresh. Make sure you get there at least a few hours before closing time, because they always seem to run out of tahini sauce then. Great food. Falafel here is highly recommended.
I think the service has improved over 2018.   Food was always great... but good portions and friendly smiles have made all the difference on the last visit... back to a 5 star in my books!

As restaurant owners who work long, and sometime strange hours, it’s always nice to come here and be treated like family. 

Excellent, fast service, and great food!
Only pita/shawarma place we visit
Keep it up boys and girls!!
I absolutely love this place. I used to go there once a week almost for breakfast when I lived closer to that area. It is absolutely amazing!

Excellent selection of mediocre warm-ish food worth half the prices paid at best. The home fries are terrible, like baked, dry and lumpy mashed potatoes. The senior waitress is friendly, clumsy, forgetful, spits in your eyes when she talks, is prompt with coffee refills but not with refilling water. Our food arrived quickly to the table. My omelette tasted fair, though I paid $3.95 for a sprinkle of feta cheese. 

I expected more from dishes priced on a higher scale. Some menu items, like the Eggs Benedict plate, are listed under the category of foods served with home fries and toast. Don't be mistaken. This dish does not come with toast, but you can expect to pay for it. 

This is a great restaurant for some who need convenience and to feel full, but the overall experience was awkward for my partner and I who's standards aren't even remotely high.

The restaurant is clean and quiet. The service is excellent. The server was first rate and attentive. The two breakfast orders were placed and arrived in a few minutes and were hot.The food , coffee and toast were perfect. The bill and tip for two was reasonable. All in all a excellent experience for my first time.
Home Style! High Quality! Personal Service!  My Breakfast was cooked to perfection! Quick and Friendly Service! Comfortable and positive atmosphere!
Good affordable breakfast....friendly staff
Eggs Benny skillet... Barely finished them.. So good and delicious.  2 dining areas and a stool area so plenty of space.  Our waitress was awesome.  Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

I love this place. Have been several times now and never disappointed. Love their Eggs Benedict and they literally have the best pancakes I have ever eaten. Too good, I dream about them. The specials are fun and interesting but make sure you get a pancake if you go.
Tasty breakfast. We both had classic breakfast and loved the potatoes. Small booths and we waited a very long time for our bill. But friendly staff and good good.

Polite and attentive staff. Has a definite diner vibe with booths and stools at the counter. The home fries were tasty. The eggs on one order came out fried instead of scrambled. The eggs florentine on the other order was good. If you're hungry and in the area it's a cozy place to stop in for a bite. We went on a snow day so it was pretty quiet  and the food came fairly quickly.

Food was great, but I was disturbed to see either the manager or the owner yelling at a younger girl who was working during a busy rush. As far as I can tell, he was upset she hadn't filled the coffees up fast enough, but that's not an excuse to talk to your employees the way this man was. I won't be returning to a restaurant that treats their employees this way.

Edit: I’ve since been contacted by the restaurant and am glad to hear this isn’t a regular occurrence as this man isn’t usually present.
Great portion size for lunch $12. Nice staff. Lots of people and great flavour. Definitely would recommend. They’re not cheap on portion sizes: definitely filled me up! Very clean too.

Staff was friendly and efficient. Facilities were clean and noise levels good for easy conversation even though it was a very busy lunch time. Food came in good time and was flavourful and warm.  I have had better pad Thai but I would go back there for lunch.  Tamirand chicken was good too.

Really disappointed as we were expecting somewhat authentic Thai food but this was not even close. The sticky rice had coconut milk added...!! That is inexcusable. The only time sticky rice ever has coconut is for mango sticky rice and that's a dessert.   I've never seen so many bell peppers in Thai food ever. I ate more bell peppers tonight than in the 5 years I lived in Bangkok. Everything was way too sweet and overall it was just flat and lacking flavour. 

The service was great. The restaurant is nice. But food is a flop if you're looking for something that is actually Thai.

Visited 4/15/19. Monday. Big sign on street. Located on the trendy section of King St. W in Dundas On.. Slow day. Parking on the street close by or in municipal parking lots. 
Service was prompt but not pushy. 
Staff seemed to be Chinese not Thai?
We were presented with an about 12 item fixed lunch menu. Selection was good and included vegetarian options.  
Portions were modest but at $14.95, including soup, I thought a little pricy but, probably not out of line for this upscale neighborhood. 
Food was attractively presented. 
Food was good but I have had better. 
Major cards accepted.

Food was amazing!  Everything so tasty and fresh!  Service was extremely helpful as one of pur party is gluten free so they helped us order.   Busy yet we didnt feel like we were rushed out.  Definitely will be going back.

I have been coming to TeaHut for many years and it is fantastic. The staff are friendly, the food is delicious and the bubble tea is tasty. They recently renovated and the new layout is welcoming and makes for a great hangout. I highly reccomend checking this place out!

Food was pretty good but the service was not. When I asked if there was MSG in the food the first answer I got was, "what's that?" And yes there is MSG. When we asked if they could change the music because it was making us feel uncomfortable we were told that it was the only playlist they had and that he wouldn't be changing it.
Great variety of foods, drinks and bubble tea options. Nice atmosphere, plenty of board games to play. Good lighting.

To whoever cooks my squid like this again, I'm going to remove a star. 😡👎This is the 3rd time I got an oily,soggy, bland and no breading squid.

I'll post a picture next time I got the right one so you'll know what I'm talking abt.

Update:
See what I mean here?ordered on the weekend. And there are 4 orders looking like this. Disappointed whenever I receive my squid like the other picture. I always ask someone to buy this for me. Not anymore.

3 stars for the 👍 bbl tea.

Teahut’s one of the last standalone teashops in Hamilton but never fails to impress. They offer a nice ambient atmosphere for studying as well as food/drinks on demand which is rare for a teashop. In my 4 years of going to Mcmaster, I’ve always left Teahut satisfied and happy.

Was just ok. Was disappointed they didnt even bother to put out any white rice for the lunch buffet and the fried rice was well, overfried. The other items were just barely, meh. For 20 bucks for 2 people, it should have been a lot better. Seemed sloppy.

reviews.author_name: A day in the life of the thurstons thurston
reviews.text: I think its the best Chinese ive ever had joy wah has nothing on this place.
Wonderful food if you get there the beginning of the lunch or dinner hour. Sorry, no more Sunday buffet. Very pleasant staff and dining
Quick service, friendly staff. Menu has good variety and prices are fair.
Slow service, mediocre food. Nice view.
The service is great and the atmosphere inside is very welcoming. The food is delicious and I would go again.
amazing authentic food! love it

I went with a friend on a Wednesday evening for dinner. The place was busy but there was a table available. We had the cutlet which came with a thick meatball soup. The dish had vegetables and potatoes with plenty of tasty gravy. The food was like home made by mom. The food was excellent and the service was good considering the fact that it was busy. We had a German beer each. The total bill was about $80. The place is nice and casual and close to parking. I would recommend this place and would go again.

Go about 6 times a year. Good food, uniforms are dated but it's a theme thing. Soups are always tremendous. We ate here last night - group of 4. We waited over an hour for a table, but it was so worth it! The schnitzel was cooked to perfection, and the potato soup was delish! Our waitress was very efficient! It is definitely worth the drive from Burlington - it’s one of our favourites! Still as good as ever! Will return soon!!!

The place has an unique interior. Service was friendly and helpful, food was typical German food, schnitzel and sausages etc. The schnitzel was huge, enough to feed 2 people. The side portions were also generous. You will not leave hungry. Beer was good.

This is my first minor complaint. Got there shortly after 6 got seated right-a-way. But waited over a hour for dinner to be brought to our table. Waitress said they had a birthday party of 20 in the room. (As per Jenny)
Been there a couple time and waited for a table for good half hour and out the door in another 30 to 45 minutes less than 2 then tonight's visit.
Yes will still go because of the food.
New menus but same decor. Even with new owners, food still great. Got rid of my favourite menu item, but lots of choices left. If you're vegan, don't bother coming here.

I come here whenever I can... I'm kind of picky with my Japanese food but... this place has AMAZING Japanese food with very quick service. People are normally very nice and patient and the place is very clean. I highly recommend especially to families. Week days lunch is cheaper than any other time :)

Well, let me start off by saying I'm a bit of a sushi & sashimi aficionado,
I have eaten it all over the world including Australia, Mexico, Jamaica, Fiji and more.. and I have to say that this is the tastiest and freshest I have had in my life! So delicious!! Customer service was excellent and the place has a great atmosphere. Oh, and their other dishes like the Beef and Broccoli were outstanding as well. Would give it 6 stars if I could! Well done, Sapporo Hamilton, very well done.

I just wish I could get Clams in the dinner buffet. Staff was polite but not paying attention to the customers. Talking to friends
That were in the restaurant..
Food was good.

A nice restaurant with mostly Japanese dishes and some Thai ones. The food was tasty, served in good time and the decor was nice. Some downsides are that the parking lot is terrible and crowded, some waiters couldn't converse in English well, and the Pad Thai wasn't very good. Overall though, it was enjoyable and we'll be going back again.

Food was really sub par. No flavour to anything. Wonton soup tasted like dishwater. Fish portions were tiny, rolls were made sloppily. Tempura bits in rolls were soggy. Not inedible but really not worth it. We ordered one eel dish that was topped with eel in the picture but when it arrived it had one, maybe two tiny pieces. We asked to send it back, manager said that eel is expensive. I understand, but pictures need to reflect what they are actually serving.

Very good food. It is usually hit or miss. But so far under new management , great improvement. Server is nice and caring too. 
Still some of work needs to be done like clearing up tables while we eat. 

Over all good experience.

Modern India is one of our go-to curry places. I love the dinner buffet at this little gem of a restaurant. The staff always greets you with a smile and attend to your needs. I completely recommend this restaurant for anyone wanting an authentic taste of Indian cuisine for a very affordable price.
We came here this evening and left very happy! The food is fresh and delicious!  Wonderful and kind  waitress, she is super friendly!  Its very affordable! My new favourite restaurant!

Went there for the first and last time for their lunch buffet. The only contact we had with the server was a smile while he handed us two glasses of water. That was it. No real greeting and didn't check for refills or if we wanted any other drinks while we ate. 

The food was not only bland but served cold. Only the curry chicken was lukewarm at best. Everything else was as if it was taken right from the refrigerator. The ice cream was old and freezer burnt.

The dishes were dirty. Had to pick through a few bowls to find one that wasn't dusty and without dirt. 

Definitely would not recommend eating here.

We are regular customers. The food is authentic, fresh and  tops the best Indian Restaurants near or far. We just had them Cater for a large party, they provided everything including servers and bartender. The owners personally attended to insure that everything was outstanding.  Every guest commented on their professionalism and amazing food. I highly recommend them as the premier option for dining in, takeout or catering small or big events. Moreover excellent service of servers as well as the owner
Average to high priced. All food options I've tried over the years have been tasty. Good at fixing order when asked. Atmosphere most of the time relaxing to chilled fun

Went with another couple for St. Patrick's Day drinks and food. Nice cold Guinness, but the Irish stew was soupy, and the soda bread was a hard cold puck. I know it was a special but it could have been better. There was live music, and that was nice. We might go back to see what the regular menu is like.

I had the French Onion soup which was simply delicious.  I'm allergic to MSG so don't often get to enough soups when eating out.  There's is completely homemade and very delicious.   Service was great, friendly,  knowledgeable, and when my hubby's stuffed chicken was taking little longer to cook than normal, they provided an update.  Hubby thought the size of the chicken breast was a little small for his liking but it would have been fine for me.  For main I had the bacon and apple cider spinach salad.  My only suggestion here is order the dressing on the side if you like a lighter touch with the dressing.

Awesome pub style bar, old factory converted into bar gives modern industrial feel. The crowds are always a good mix of hip and mature folks making for a pretty good time. They have live entertainment and so far it has not disappointed, although some bands get very loud. The vibe is always upbeat and the service is friendly. 
Usually a pretty busy place come the weekend but worth a visit for the experience.
5 stars for a one of a kind bar experience!

Was here for a baby shower. The staff were attentive and made sure everyone always had beverages. Wish you recycled, as everything from the party went to the garbage. Great variety for the lunch buffet.

This is the best restaurant in Hamilton!!! I visit it regularly since the summer of 2018, and it never disappointed me. 

 Kristine and Claudio always make you feel like home. This place is cozy and full of warmth. It has a unique, nostalgic atmosphere, lots of vintage photographs, an elegant fireplace, and sophisticated music. The waiters provide first-rate service, making guests feel like aristocrats. 

 The food is HEAVENLY!!! The salmon is my personal favorite (thank you, Chef Kristine, I will always remember how you prepared it for me in the middle of a snowstorm ❤️).

 In conclusion, I highly recommend this place to everyone who likes delicious Italian cuisine and relaxed, welcoming ambiance of a small, but exquisitely charming restaurant.

A busy preChristmas evening, but wonderful food and excellent service. We shared a wonderful calamari appetizer, followed by a delicious pasta special wth generous pieces of lobster, and Veal Henry which was equally good. For desserts, tiramisu, and lemon sorbet served in a hollowed out lemon provided a fitting end to a superb meal. Wine by the glass was pricey, but very good, and better value than highly priced bottles. The staff were professional and friendly, and chef Kristine visited all the tables, and hugged us when we expressed our appreciation. We would definitely go again to celebrate a special occasion.

My wife and I and another couple went on a Wed night and had a fabulous dinner at Claudio's.  I've had dinner and lunch here on several occasions in the past and have never been let down by the food or service.  Two of us had the Gnocchi & Braised Rib special which was outstanding!!  The Veal Henry was excellent and the Spaghetti Carbonara was superb & plentiful (we took home half of it)!!  I find some of the comments regarding price surprising.  This is a fine dining restaurant with white linen tables offering excellent food and service that is NO more expensive than a Keg Steakhouse or similar.  I found pricing on food and wine to be extremely reasonable!  Host Claudio and wife/chef  Kristine are always pleasant and checking to see if everything is to our satisfaction!  Don't hesitate to dine here - you won't be disappointed!
Great service and atmosphere.  The food and wine were delicious. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
Authentic Italian food created and prepared by the owner, served in a relaxing atmosphere

We had a late valentines day dinner here and from the moment we stepped in we were impressed.   We didn't wait long to be seated and there was a server within mins to take care of us.  Our food was delicious and filling.  We ended up bringing a portion of our food home to enjoy at home.   The only thing that made it a 4star was the speed of the food once we ordered.  Given the fact it was very busy there were two other couples near us that came after us and were served their food before us.

I’ve loved this place for years. Hadn’t been in a few months, & was shocked at the price increases. 
$22 for a Ceasar salad at lunch? Food, service & atmosphere all great still, but I won’t be going here anymore. They’ve priced themselves out of my range.

The service was excellent - the servers were very attentive. The portions were large and the food was incredible!  Chef John came to our table and made our evening truly special.  We had the pasta special with mushroom soup to start, and the gorgonzola gnocchi with arugula salad to start. This is my favourite restaurant, hands down.

Visited Feb 28,2019  Food is great but went their on a Thursday at around 5:00pm. From the time we ordered and the time it came took 45 minutes.  It was the not the waitress as she made a joke about giving the cooks an evil eye and maybe they would take the hint.  Pasta dosen`t take that long to cook.  I also find the prices have jumped quite a bit. I don't think I will be returning.

Really great food. A wide variety of Italian specialties. Very good attentive service. Expensive though. One draw back: the restrooms are downstairs accessed only by a set of stairs. Well appointed but not overly accessible. Use your cane and take your time.

The Rousseau House is always a fantastic place to eat!  If you have never tried their Signature Rousseau House Burger it is a must!  
You can go just to have a drink and some light fare or you can have a fine dining experience they are equipped for either. Another nice feature is that they are able to host parties with their designated private rooms. I planned a Christmas party with them for 50 people and it was a wonderful experience as the ambience and menu did not disappoint.
They are currently in the process of adding a brewery, so be sure to check it out.
I would not hesitate to recommend this establishment to my family and friends. 
Stop in sometime, you'll be glad you did.

I enjoyed Eating at Rousseau House.  The truffle fries were fabulous as was the desert. I had steak fettucine which was pretty good but I wish there was a little bit more cheese. Overall I have to say the ambiance and the service was wonderful and I would definitely go back.

Our first time there and we decided to start with their Tapas menu. I ordered a martini,  and it turned out to be watery and mostly vodka. The rest of our table ordered wine, which was fine.  However, the waiter never returned to ask us how your drinks were after he served them.  When the tapas dishes came to our table they looked some what appetizing. However, most were average in taste, some tasteless,  and the fries, especially, were soggy and although advertised as " truffle fries",  we couldn't taste any truffle flavor in them.  The food was well below our expectations for a restaurant we thought was suppose to be one of the best in the area. We were so disappointed in the tapas plates we ordered that we decided against ordering anything else. Also the service was very average as our waiter didn't look very happy and was not attentive and never checked with us to ask if we were enjoying our food. It didn't seem like he was enjoying his job at all!  We left very disappointed in the whole experience, and all agreed that we would never go back.
Mary Quite location with private room with tons's of charm

We had our rehearsal dinner here, in the solarium room for about 16 people.  Couldn't have been better--food was great, price was right and they were open late which is what we needed.

For anyone getting married at the Mill, this is a cheaper alternative that is only a 1min drive down the street.  Highly recommend.

Great experience great food. I ordered the buffalo  was a little freezer burnt, but, otherwise what a great experience.  Louie was a true excellent host. We will definitely be back. Next time for the true Italian beef and lamb that they are famous for. 
Our hats are off to Shakespeare's great atmosphere.

Excellent nostalgic restaurant and amazing food. Yes they are on the expensive side but the food, experience and attentive staff make it worth the price. When looking for a fancy night out for a special occasion this is the pace to be. I proposed to the woman of my dreams and they made the night that much more special. We will definitely be back!!!!!

This restaurant is a long-established business in Hamilton and it is easy to see why it has withstood the test of time. The service was excellent. The wait staff was attentive without being annoying. They had a delicious pickle and olive tray at the table as we ordered. The food was exceptional. All of the guests at our table thoroughly enjoyed every bit of their meal. They have an impressive wine selection and the desserts were amazing. We'll be back again.

A wonderful dining experience!! You are waited on hand and foot!! Garlic bread is the best I have ever eaten and they bring you plenty of it. Steak was perfectly cooked!! Whole atmosphere was something to become!! Going back this Saturday to bring my parents so they can experience fine dining at it's best!!!!!
Have been going to this place for over 40 years. Still love it. Great food and personal service.
